newtwist2000 wrote:
> 
> there is some brief explanation of the inputs used in that file. As
> it stands, the inputs are based on a window centered around PacMan

re: Inputs..  I wonder if some global information in addition to your 
local observations may be useful?  For example, you may divide the grid 
up into 2x2 (quadrants), or even 3x3 (nonants?), and make observations 
thusly.  You may even make these observations linear (rather than 
binary), for example based on number of ghosts/food/etc in a section, or 
the weighted distance of all ghosts/food/etc from the center of a 
section.  With such added global information, you'd also need to provide 
input as to where PacMan currently resides (so he might know which 
section is most relevant).

And of course, this problem is screaming for HyperNEAT.  :)

BTW - mine did crash after I hit B and waited a few generations.  I got 
no exception dialog though, it just disappeared.

Still, good work!

--Steve
